com.yantra.yfc.rcp

Class YRCPlatformUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.YRCPlatformUI

  • public class YRCPlatformUI
extends java.lang.Object
    Main class that provides several useful static utilities for use within Sterling Rich Client Platform applications.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • registerPlugin

        public static void registerPlugin(java.lang.String pluginId,
                                  org.eclipse.ui.plugin.AbstractUIPlugin plugin)
        It is suggeted that every plugin that is part of Sterling RCP, invoke this method to register itself with Sterling rich client platform. Several of the features such as resource bundles, themes, configuration, UI extension, etc. depend on a plugin being registered.

        Sample code: 
         public class TestPlugin extends AbstractUIPlugin {
 
        private static TestPlugin plugin;
        public static final String ID = "com.mycompany.test.rcp";
 
        public TestPlugin () {
                super();
                plugin = this;
                try {
                        YRCPlatformUI.registerPlugin(ID, this);
                } catch (Exception ex) {
                        YRCPlatformUI.trace(ex);
                }
        }
 }

        Parameters:
        pluginId - ID of the plugin that is being registered.
        plugin - Plugin instance of the plugin that is being registered.

        See Also:
        registerBundle(String, String), registerCommands(String, String), registerTheme(String, String)

      • getPluginClass

        public static java.lang.Class getPluginClass(java.lang.String pluginId)

        Internal utility to obtain plugin Class given an ID.

        Parameters:
        pluginId -
        Returns:
        Class corresponding to the plugin or null no plugin is found for the given ID.

      • registerBundle

        public static void registerBundle(java.lang.String baseBundleName,
                                  java.lang.String pluginId)
        Every plugin that requires its own bundle should invoke this during plugin initialization (preferably within plugin constructor) to register its bundle. When registerd, standard bundle loading (using user's current locale) is performed. Use YRCPlatformUI.getString() method to obtain localized value.

        Note: Before calling this method plugin should have registered itself using registerPlugin method of this class.

        Note: Bundle file must have extension "properties".

        Sample code: 
         public class TestPlugin extends AbstractUIPlugin {
 
        private static TestPlugin plugin;
        public static final String ID = "com.mycompany.test.rcp";
 
        public TestPlugin () {
                super();
                plugin = this;
                try {
                        YRCPlatformUI.registerPlugin(ID, this);
                        // Use of standard theme name <pluginid>_bundle.properties is highly suggested
                        YRCPlatformUI.registerTheme("com.mycompany.test.rcp_bundle", ID);
                } catch (Exception ex) {
                        YRCPlatformUI.trace(ex);
                }
        }
 }

        Parameters:
        baseBundleName - Name of the base bundle file without extension.
        pluginId - ID of the plugin that is registering the bundle.

        See Also:
        getString(String), registerPlugin(String, AbstractUIPlugin)

      • registerTheme

        public static void registerTheme(java.lang.String baseThemeName,
                                 java.lang.String pluginId)
        Every plugin that requires its own theme should invoke this during plugin initialization (preferably within plugin constructor) to register its theme. When registerd, theme is loaded based on user's current locale (similar to bundle lookup scheme to support locale specific theme). All theme definitions are loaded into a common repository and are applied to controls on the UI automatically. Last loaded theme overrides previous definitions.

        Note: Before calling this method plugin should have registered itself using registerPlugin method of this class.

        Note: Theme file must have extension "ythm".

        Sample code: 
         public class TestPlugin extends AbstractUIPlugin {
 
        private static TestPlugin plugin;
        public static final String ID = "com.mycompany.test.rcp";
 
        public TestPlugin () {
                super();
                plugin = this;
                try {
                        YRCPlatformUI.registerPlugin(ID, this);
                        // Use of standard theme name <pluginid>_<themeid>.ythm is highly suggested
                        YRCPlatformUI.registerTheme("com.mycompany.test.rcp_skyblue", ID);
                } catch (Exception ex) {
                        YRCPlatformUI.trace(ex);
                }
        }
 }

        Parameters:
        baseThemeName - Name of the base theme file without extension.
        pluginId - ID of the plugin that is registering the theme.

        See Also:
        registerPlugin(String, AbstractUIPlugin)

      • registerCommands

        public static void registerCommands(java.lang.String commandsFile,
                                    java.lang.String pluginId)
        Every plugin that requires its own set of commands (commands are an abstraction over backend APIs) should register its set of commands. Command names are unique across the system and reusing a command name will override an exisiting definition.

        Note: Before calling this method plugin should have registered itself using registerPlugin method of this class.

        Sample code: 
         public class TestPlugin extends AbstractUIPlugin {
 
        private static TestPlugin plugin;
        public static final String ID = "com.mycompany.test.rcp";
 
        public TestPlugin () {
                super();
                plugin = this;
                try {
                        YRCPlatformUI.registerPlugin(ID, this);
                        // Use of standard name <pluginid>_commands.ycml is highly suggested
                        YRCPlatformUI.registerCommands("com.mycompany.test.rcp_commands.ycml", ID);
                } catch (Exception ex) {
                        YRCPlatformUI.trace(ex);
                }
        }
 }

        Parameters:
        commandsFile - Name of the command file including extension.
        pluginId - ID of the plugin that is registering these commands.

        See Also:
        registerPlugin(String, AbstractUIPlugin)

      • addDisposableObject

        public static void addDisposableObject(IYRCDisposable disposableObject)
        All the objects that should be disposed off at the time of application exit must be explicitely added using this method. Typically OS resources such as fonts, colors, cursor, etc. must be explicitely disposed off. It is suggested that you use this class's utility methods to obtain these types of resources. But, if you have a class on which dispose method needs to be called during application exit add that class using this method.

        Parameters:
        disposableObject - A class that implements IYRCDisposable interface

        See Also:

      • registerExtensions

        public static void registerExtensions(java.lang.String fileName,
                                      java.lang.String pluginId)
        Every plugin that is extending Sterling RCP UI elements should register its set of form extensions using this method. This is only required if you are extending forms that are already in the system. For completely new forms, no registeration of this sort is required. All forms have unique IDs that are used to define the extensions.

        Note: Before calling this method plugin should have registered itself using registerPlugin method of this class.

        Sample code: 
         public class TestPlugin extends AbstractUIPlugin {
 
        private static TestPlugin plugin;
        public static final String ID = "com.mycompany.test.rcp";
 
        public TestPlugin () {
                super();
                plugin = this;
                try {
                        YRCPlatformUI.registerPlugin(ID, this);
                        // Use of standard name <pluginid>_extensions.yuix is highly suggested
                        YRCPlatformUI.registerExtentions("com.mycompany.test.rcp_extensions.yuix", ID);
                } catch (Exception ex) {
                        YRCPlatformUI.trace(ex);
                }
        }
 }

        Parameters:
        fileName - Name of the XML file that defines UI extensions.
        pluginId - ID of the plugin that is registering these UI extensions.

        See Also:
        registerPlugin(String, AbstractUIPlugin)

      • getString

        public static java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String key)
        Utility method to get localized strings given a key. If no translation is found, this method returns "!<key>!". Exclamation marks are appended before and after the key to let the developers know that the bundle entry is missing.

        Parameters:
        key - Bundle key.
        Returns:
        Localized string from bundle. If no bundle entry is found, this method returns key with exclamation marks on both side. If the given key is void, this method returns an non-null empty string.

        See Also:
        getString(String, String), registerBundle(String, String)

      • getString

        public static java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String key,
                                         java.lang.String pluginId)
        Utility method to get localized strings given a key. If no translation is found, this method returns "!<key>!". Exclamation marks are appended before and after the key to let the developers know that the bundle entry is missing. All registered bundles are maintained in plugin specific maps to enable plugin specific localization.
        Parameters:
        key - Bundle key.
        pluginId - The plugin id for which one needs to look for localization. This has been necessiated due to the presence of multiple plugins contributing to the same application and we wish to avoid any inadvertent clash in bundle entry.
        Returns:
        Localized string from bundle. If no bundle entry is found, this method returns key with exclamation marks on both side. If the given key is void, this method returns an non-null empty string.

        See Also:
        registerBundle(String, String)

      • getDBString

        public static java.lang.String getDBString(java.lang.String key)
        Utility method to get database localized string given a key. If no translation is found, this method returns the key.

        Parameters:
        key - key to be lookedup.
        Returns:
        Localized string from database. If no entry is found, this method returns the key. If the given key is void, this method returns an non-null empty string.

      • getFormattedString

        public static java.lang.String getFormattedString(java.lang.String key,
                                                  java.lang.String data)
        Utility method to get localized string with parameters filled in. This method uses MessageFormat.format to format the localized string with given parameter. Use this method instead of doing string concatnations.

        Sample code: 

            public void someMethod() {
        String orderNo = "ORDR1234";
        // let us say, we want to print a message "Order number ORDR1234 created"
        String msg =  "Order number "+orderNo+" created"; // wrong way
        showMessage2User(msg);
        // correct way is to use a bundle key to retrieve the localized string
        // and insert data at appropriate place.
        String msg = YRCPlatformUI.getFormattedString("order_created_message", orderNo);
        showMessage2User(msg);
    }
 }

        Parameters:
        key - Used to get localalized string from the bundle.
        data - Some application data that needs to be replaced within the message at appropriate place.
        Returns:
        Formatted message with data replaced within the bundle string. If no bundle entry is found, this method returns key with exclamation marks on both side. If the given key is void, this method returns an non-null empty string.

        See Also:
        getString(String), registerBundle(String, String)

      • getFormattedString

        public static java.lang.String getFormattedString(java.lang.String key,
                                                  java.lang.String data,
                                                  java.lang.String pluginId)
        Parameters:
        key - Used to get localalized string from the bundle.
        data - Some application data that needs to be replaced within the message at appropriate place.
        pluginId - The plugin id.
        Returns:
        Formatted message with data replaced within the bundle string. If no bundle entry is found, this method returns key with exclamation marks on both side. If the given key is void, this method returns an non-null empty string.

        See Also:
        getString(String, String), registerBundle(String, String)

      • isTraceEnabled

        public static boolean isTraceEnabled()
        Utility method indicating if debug trace is enabled. Use this method if you have an expensive operation to create a string representation before calling trace. Otherwise trace method can be called directly by passing the data as is.

        Sample code: 

            public void someMethod() {
        String orderNo = "ORDR1234";
        // let us say, we want to print a debug trace message "Order number is ORDR1234";
        YRCPlatformUI.trace("Order number is", orderNo);
        // another example with XML
        Element ordrXml = getOrderXml();
        YRCPlatformUI.trace("Order XML is", ordrXml);
 
        // now, let us say, you have a complex object that does not have toString implemented
        // and you wish to trace that object and let us say, you have a private method to convert
        // this object to a string.
        MyComplexClass myComplexObj = new MyComplexClass();
        YRCPlatformUI.trace("Order XML is", getStringFor(myComplexObj)); // WRONG way
        // since the getStringFor operation is expensive, right way is to use isTraceEnabled check
        if(YRCPlatformUI.isTraceEnabled()){ // CORRECT way
            YRCPlatformUI.trace("Order XML is", getStringFor(myComplexObj));
        }
    }
 
    private Element getOrderXml() {
        Element ordrXml = null; 
        // get order XML from an API and return it
        return ordrXml;
    }
 
    private String getStringFor(MyComplexClass myComplexObj) {
        String str = null;
        // expensive operation to get String representation of myComplexObj
        return str;
    }
 
 }

        Returns:
        true if debug trace is enabled.

        See Also:
        trace(String, Object), trace(Object)

      • isTimerTraceEnabled

        public static boolean isTimerTraceEnabled()
        Utility method to be used to check if the timer trace is enabled . It is recommended for use, if there is an expensive string operation.
        Returns:
        true if the timer trace is set , false otherwise .

      • trace

        public static void trace(java.lang.String msg,
                         java.lang.Object traceObj)
        Utility method to do debug trace statements. This method explicitely handles Document, Element, Map, List, Exception other than String and StringBuffer. For all other objects it calls toString. It is highly suggested that you implement toString for all custom classes that need to be traced. Use isTraceEnabled if you have to do string conversion outside to avoid unnecessary overhead.

        Parameters:
        msg - Message that should be printed before the trace data.
        traceObj - Object that needs to be traced.

        See Also:
        isTraceEnabled(), trace(Object)

      • trace

        public static void trace(java.lang.Object traceObj)
        Utility method to trace an object. See trace(String, Object) description. No additional message witll be printed.

        Parameters:
        traceObj - Object that needs to be traced.

        See Also:
        trace(String, Object), isTraceEnabled()

      • registerMachineGetter

        public static void registerMachineGetter(IYRCMachineDetailsGetter getter)
        This method provides plugins a way to register custom machine details getter object (a class that implements IYRCMachineDetailsGetter interface). Whenever application requests for the machine details (e.g., Pack station module of Sterling Supply Chain Applications may require the current station id or machine id to determine nearest printer), this registered object is used. If no machine details getter object is registered, optionally infrastructure propmts the user to enter the details (see getMachineDetails description).

        Note: Sterling RCP provides default implementation for obtaining machine details in various ways (see the optional plugin com.yantra.yfc.rcp.op). Only if you want to have your own way of obtaining machine details, you will need to call this method.

        Sample code: 
         public class TestPlugin extends AbstractUIPlugin {
 
        private static TestPlugin plugin;
        public static final String ID = "com.mycompany.test.rcp";
 
        public TestPlugin () {
                super();
                plugin = this;
                try {
                        YRCPlatformUI.registerPlugin(ID, this);
                        // register your own machine details getter if required
                        YRCPlatformUI.registerMachineGetter(new IYRCMachineDetailsGetter() {
 
                                public YRCMachineDetails getMachineDetails() {
                                        YRCMachineDetails md = getMachineDetailsSomeHow();
                                        return md;
                                }
                        });
                } catch (Exception ex) {
                        YRCPlatformUI.trace(ex);
                }
        }
 
        private YRCMachineDetails getMachineDetailsSomeHow() {
                YRCMachineDetails md = new YRCMachineDetails();
                String mid = "PC1234"; // obtain this your own way
                md.setMachineId(mid);
                String mname = "PC1234_Name"; // obtain this your own way
                md.setMachineName(mname);
                return md;
        }
 }

        Parameters:
        getter - Machine details getter object instance.

        See Also:
        getMachineDetails(boolean), IYRCMachineDetailsGetter

      • getMachineDetails

        public static YRCMachineDetails getMachineDetails(boolean promptIfNotSet)
        Utility method to get details of current machine. This method uses registered IYRCMachineDetailsGetter instance (see registerMachineGetter). If no machine details getter is registered and if promptIfNotSet is passed as true, it prompts the user for machine details. This is done only once per session. User entered data is not persisted.

        Parameters:
        promptIfNotSet - Flag to indicate if user needs to be prompted if no machine details is set. This propmting is done only once per session.
        Returns:
        Machine details of the current machine. Never null.

        See Also:
        registerMachineGetter(IYRCMachineDetailsGetter), YRCMachineDetails

      • callApi

        public static void callApi(YRCApiContext ctx,
                           IYRCApiCallbackhandler handler)
        Utility to invoke a backend API. Context defines all the API parameters. Refer to YRCApiContext for parameter details. Full screen is disabled while the API is being called and appropriate cursor is set.

        Note:API must be called from a UI thread. After setting the cursor etc. actual API is called in a non-UI thread and the response is retuned asynchronously via the given IYRCApiCallbackhandler.

        Most of the time API calls originate from behavior classes and should be called using callApi method of YRCBaseBehavior.

        Sample code: 
             YRCApiContext ctx = new YRCApiContext();
     ctx.setApiName("CreateOrderCommand");//this is a command name and must be a registered command.
     Document orderDoc = getOrderDoc();//get input XML
     IYRCApiCallbackhandler handler = new IYRCApiCallbackhandler() {
         public void handleApiCompletion(YRCApiContext ctx) {
             // When the API call is done this method is called
             // response is also part of YRCApiContext object
             if (ctx.getInvokeAPIStatus() > 0) {//API success
                 // continue processing
             }
             else {
                 // show appropriate error message to user
             }
         }
     });
     ctx.setInputXml(orderDoc);
     YRCPlatformUI.callApi(ctx, handler);
     // since API calling is asynchronous, control retuns immediately

        Parameters:
        ctx - Api context object defining all parameters.
        handler - Api call back handler. When the Api call returns, handleApiCompletion method of handler will be called.

        See Also:
        registerCommands(String, String), IYRCApiCallbackhandler, YRCBaseBehavior

      • callApi

        public static void callApi(YRCApiContext ctx,
                           IYRCApiCallbackhandler handler,
                           org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control ctrlToDisable)
        Utility to invoke a backend API. See callApi(YRCApiContext) for details. If a control is passed then instead of disabling the whole screen, only that control is disabled. Busy cursor is always set for the whole screen. For example, if you have a Composite that needs to be disabled while the API is being called and if you want to allow user to work on other screens, use this method.

        Note: It is highly suggested that you use simple callApi call instead of this one.

        Parameters:
        ctx - Api context object defining all parameters.
        handler - Api call back handler. When the Api call returns, handleApiCompletion method of handler will be called.
        ctrlToDisable - Control that needs to be disabled during API call

        See Also:
        callApi(YRCApiContext, IYRCApiCallbackhandler)

      • callApi

        public static void callApi(YRCApiContext ctx,
                           IYRCApiCallbackhandler handler,
                           boolean callInCurrentThread)
        Utility to invoke a backend API. Context defines all the API parameters. Refer to YRCApiContext for parameter details. Full screen is disabled while the API is being called and appropriate cursor is set.

        Note:API must be called from a UI thread. After setting the cursor etc. actual API is called in a non-UI thread and the response is retuned asynchronously via the given IYRCApiCallbackhandler.

        Most of the time API calls originate from behavior classes and should be called using callApi method of YRCBaseBehavior.

        Sample code: 
             YRCApiContext ctx = new YRCApiContext();
     ctx.setApiName("CreateOrderCommand");//this is a command name and must be a registered command.
     Document orderDoc = getOrderDoc();//get input XML
     IYRCApiCallbackhandler handler = new IYRCApiCallbackhandler() {
         public void handleApiCompletion(YRCApiContext ctx) {
             // When the API call is done this method is called
             // response is also part of YRCApiContext object
             if (ctx.getInvokeAPIStatus() > 0) {//API success
                 // continue processing
             }
             else {
                 // show appropriate error message to user
             }
         }
     });
     ctx.setInputXml(orderDoc);
     YRCPlatformUI.callApi(ctx, handler);
     // since API calling is asynchronous, control retuns immediately

        Parameters:
        ctx - Api context object defining all parameters.
        handler - Api call back handler. When the Api call returns, handleApiCompletion method of handler will be called.
        callInCurrentThread - Whether to call in Current thread.

        See Also:
        registerCommands(String, String), IYRCApiCallbackhandler, YRCBaseBehavior

      • getCursor

        public static org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Cursor getCursor(int style)
        Utility method to get a cursor object. Cursor being an OS resource, must be explicitely disposed and hence creating cursor object outside is highly discouraged. This method also caches the cursors for subsequent use. All cursors are disposed off when the application ends.

        Note: DO NOT call dispose method on the returned cursor object.

        Sample code: 
         Cursor cur = YRCPlatformUI.getCursor(SWT.CURSOR_HAND);
 if (cur != null) {
        orderLabel.setCursor(cur);
 }

        Parameters:
        style - Cursor style - Use values from SWT constants such as SWT.CURSOR_HAND
        Returns:
        Cursor object based on the style provided. Null, if for some reason, cursor cannot be created.

      • getImage

        public static org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image getImage(java.lang.String themeEntry)
        Utility method to get an image for a theme entry. Image being an OS resource, must be explicitely disposed and hence creating image object outside is highly discouraged. This method also caches the images for subsequent use. All images are disposed off when the application ends.

        Note: DO NOT call dispose method on the returned image object.

        Sample code: 
         Image img = YRCPlatformUI.getImage("OrderIcon");
 if (img != null) {
        orderLabel.setImage(img);
 }

        Parameters:
        themeEntry - Name of the theme entry to be used, as defined in the plugin theme file.
        Returns:
        Image object based on given input. Null, if image cannot be found or an exception occurs during load.

        See Also:
        registerTheme(String, String)

      • getBackGroundColor

        public static org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Color getBackGroundColor(java.lang.String themeEntry)
        Utility method to get a Backgound color object as defined in the theme. Color being an OS resource, must be explicitely disposed and hence creating color object outside is highly discouraged. This method gets the colors from the cache. All colors are disposed off when the application ends.

        Note: DO NOT call dispose method on the returned color object.

        Sample code: 
         Color clr = YRCPlatformUI.getBackGroundColor(YRCConstants.YRC_VALIDATION_ERROR_THEME);
 if (clr != null) {
        orderLabel.setBackground(clr);
 }

        Parameters:
        themeEntry - Name of the theme entry to be used, as defined in the plugin theme file.
        Returns:
        Color object based on the theme name provided. Null, if for some reason, color cannot be found.

        See Also:
        registerTheme(String, String)

      • getForeGroundColor

        public static org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Color getForeGroundColor(java.lang.String themeEntry)
        Utility method to get a Foreground color object as defined in the theme. Color being an OS resource, must be explicitely disposed and hence creating color object outside is highly discouraged. This method gets the colors from the cache. All colors are disposed off when the application ends.

        Note: DO NOT call dispose method on the returned color object.

        Sample code: 
         Color clr = YRCPlatformUI.getForeGroundColor(YRCConstants.YRC_VALIDATION_ERROR_THEME);
 if (clr != null) {
        orderLabel.setForeground(clr);
 }

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Color object based on the theme name provided. Null, if for some reason, color cannot be found.

        See Also:
        registerTheme(String, String)

      • playAudio

        public static void playAudio(java.lang.String themeEntry)
        Utility method to play a audio file as defined in the theme.
        Sample theme entry: 
            <ThemeEntry Name="AlertPopupAudio">
       <Audio Path="/audio/alertpopup.wav" LoopCount="3" />
    </ThemeEntry>

        Note: Currently only wav files are supported.
        Parameters:
        themeEntry - Name of the theme entry to be used, as defined in the plugin theme file.

        See Also:
        registerTheme(String, String)

      • getFont

        public static org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Font getFont(java.lang.String themeEntry)
        Utility method to get a font object as defined in the theme. Font being an OS resource, must be explicitely disposed and hence creating font object outside is highly discouraged. This method retreives the fonts from cache. All fonts are disposed off when the application ends.

        Note: DO NOT call dispose method on the returned font object.

        Sample code: 
         Font fnt = YRCPlatformUI.getFont(YRCConstants.YRC_VALIDATION_ERROR_THEME);
 if (fnt != null) {
        orderLabel.setFont(fnt);
 }

        Parameters:
        themeEntry - Name of the theme entry to be used, as defined in the plugin theme file.
        Returns:
        Font object based on the themeName provided. Null, if for some reason, font cannot be created.

        See Also:
        registerTheme(String, String)

      • getHeight

        public static int getHeight(java.lang.String themeEntry)
        Utility method to get the height from a theme element.

        Sample code: 
         int ht = YRCPlatformUI.getHeight("MyThemeName");

        Parameters:
        themeEntry - Name of the theme entry to be used, as defined in the plugin theme file.
        Returns:
        Height as specified in theme XML. If not found, returns -1.

        See Also:
        registerTheme(String, String)

      • getWidth

        public static int getWidth(java.lang.String themeEntry)
        Utility method to get the width from a theme element.

        Sample code: 
         int wd = YRCPlatformUI.getHeight("MyThemeName");

        Parameters:
        themeEntry - Name of the theme entry to be used, as defined in the plugin theme file.
        Returns:
        Width as specified in theme XML. If not found, returns -1.

                                 java.lang.String PLUGIN_ID,
                                 YRCXmlEditorInput editorInput)
        Utility method to open a editor programatically. A check is made to see if current user has permission on the resource specified.

      • openEditor

        public static boolean openEditor(java.lang.String EDITOR_ID,
                                 java.lang.String PLUGIN_ID,
                                 YRCXmlEditorInput editorInput,
                                 boolean checkPermission)
        Utility method to open a editor programatically. A check is made to see if current user has permission on the resource if specified. Note: editorInput is used to identify if an editor is already open with the same input. If an editor is already open with the same input then focus is given to the existing editor and the method returns true.

        Sample code: 

         String EDITOR_ID = "com.yantra.rcp.yfc.test.latest.OrderEditor";
 String PLUGIN_ID = "com.yantra.rcp.yfc.test.latest";
 Element inputElement = YRCXmlUtils.createFromString("<order id='1'/>").getDocumentElement();
 String[] comparisionAttributes = new String[] { "id" };
 YRCXmlEditorInput editorInput = new YRCXmlEditorInput(inputElement, comparisionAttributes);
 boolean checkPermission = true;
 YRCPlatformUI.openEditor(EDITOR_ID, PLUGIN_ID, editorInput, checkPermission);

        Parameters:
        EDITOR_ID - ID of the editor to be opened.
        PLUGIN_ID - Plugin Id in which the editor is defined.
        editorInput - Input specified to the editor during startup.
        checkPermission - Flag to indicate if permission check is required.
        Returns:
        True if the editor is opened successully, False if an exception occurs or user does not have permission on the resource.
        See Also:
        YRCXmlEditorInput.equals(Object)

      • closeAllEditors

      • showCalendar

        public static java.lang.String showCalendar(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Text dateText,
                                            java.util.Date disableBeforeDate,
                                            java.lang.String dateFormat)
        Utility method to display the calendar window. The selected value is returned back as a String parameter.
        Parameters:
        dateText - Control into which the selected date needs to be set. This parameter can be null.
        disableBeforeDate - The date before which date selection needs to be disabled. If null is passed, then the dates wil not be disabled.
        dateFormat - The formatter used for date formatting. If it is null, it will be defaulted to the users default simple date formatter.
        Returns:
        The selected date string.

      • fireAction

        public static boolean fireAction(java.lang.String actionId)
        Utility method to invoke an action based on the action ID. Looks up the action from all plugins and performs the action.

        NOTE: This method will initialize the plugin in which the actionID is defined. IAction argument which is required by the run method is passed as null.

        Sample code: 

         private void showMyView() {
        String actionOpenMyView = "actionOpenMyView"; // Action ID which opens the view.
        YRCPlatformUI.fireAction(actionOpenMyView);
 }
        Parameters:
        actionId - ID of the action which needs to be invoked.
        Returns:
        boolean to indicate if action was found and executed. True if action was found and executed, false otherwise.

      • getControlWidth

        public static int getControlWidth(java.lang.String dataTypeName,
                                  java.lang.String themeEntry)
        Utility method which returns the width to be set on the control based on the data type and theme provided. For eg:- if the Size attribute provided in the UIType child element of the DataType element is 10 and the PixelMultipier attribute given in the Font child element of the ThemeEntry Element is 7 then the control width that is returned is 70. If the UIType child element is not specified then the size attribute of the DataType element is multiplied with the PixelMultiplier.
        Parameters:
        dataTypeName - the specified dataType
        themeEntry - the specified theme
        Returns:
        the width to be set on the control or -1 in case the width cannnot be calculated.

        public static org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite launchWizard(java.lang.String wizardId,
                                                             org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent,
                                                             java.lang.Object input)
        Utility method to invoke a wizard.
        NOTE: The following conditions need to be met for the method to complete successfully.
        • All the wizard pages should have the 'className' attribute defined in the wizard deinition.
        • All the wizard pages should have at least one of the following constructors defined:
          • constructor with arguments (Composite parent, int style)
          • constructor with arguments (Composite parent, int style, Object input)

        Parameters:
        wizardId - The id of the wizard to be started.
        parent - The parent composite in which a wizard needs to be opened.
        input - The input object using which the wizard needs to be constructed.

      • launchWizard

        public static org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite launchWizard(java.lang.String wizardId,
                                                             org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent)
        Utility method to invoke a wizard.
        This method inturn invokes launchWizard(String, Composite, Object) assuming input to be null.
        Parameters:
        wizardId - The id of the wizard to be started.
        parent - The parent composite in which a wizard needs to be opened.
        See Also:
        launchWizard(String, Composite, Object)

      • getExtensionPointString

        public static java.lang.String getExtensionPointString(java.lang.String extensionPointId,
                                                       java.lang.String extensionRootElementName,
                                                       java.lang.String extensionValueName,
                                                       java.util.HashMap extensionFilterMap)
        Utility method to return the content of the value attribute associated with the extensionValueName in the ExtensionValue element of the extension point. Refer getExtensionPointClass(String, String, HashMap) for details about how this method works and how it needs to be invoked.
        Parameters:
        extensionPointId - The id of the extension point.
        extensionRootElementName - The root element name of the extension point. Can be null.
        extensionValueName - The content of the name attribute in the ExtensionValue element of the extension point.
        extensionFilterMap - The map of filter values based on which the extension is identified.
        Returns:
        The contents of the value attribute associated with the extensionValueName in the ExtensionValue element associated with the extension point.
        See Also:
        getExtensionPointClass(String, String, HashMap)

      • getExtensionPointClass

        public static java.lang.Object getExtensionPointClass(java.lang.String extensionPointId,
                                                      java.lang.String extensionRootElementName,
                                                      java.util.HashMap extensionFilterMap)
        Utility method to return an object of the class which is specified in the className attribute associated with the extension point.
        IMPORTANT: The extension point should follow the structure which is described below: 
                <extension
             point="com.yantra.pca.scv.rcp.Test1">
          <AlertConfigPanels>
             <AlertConfigPanel className="com.yantra.pca.scv.rcp.extensions.AlertConfigPanel">
                <ExtensionFilter
                      name="AlertType"
                      value="PO Delayed"/>
                <ExtensionFilter
                      name="EnterpriseCode"
                      value="DEFAULT"/>
                <ExtensionValue
                      name="Arg1"
                      value="Val1"/>
                <ExtensionValue
                      name="Arg2"
                      value="Val2"/>
             </AlertConfigPanel>
          </AlertConfigPanels>
        </extension>

        Points to note from the above extension point struture:
        • AlertConfigPanel is the extension root element name.
        • className should exist as an attribute of the extension root element.
        • className attribute should point to a java class as documented by the rcp application providing the extension point and should have a default empty constructor.
        • className attribute should extend/implement a java class as documented by the rcp application.
        • The extension point should have the ability to define multiple ExtensionFilter elements.
        • Each ExtensionFilter element should have name and value attributes, and both the attributes should be mandatory.
        • The extension point should have the ability to define multiple ExtensionValue elements.
        • Each ExtensionValue element should have name and value attributes, and both the attributes should be mandatory.
        • The ExtensionFilter elements are used to determine the class to invoke.
        • The ExtensionValue elements are used to store data which might be required for processing.

        USAGE: The following code shows how these methods can be used: 
                        // The extension point id.
                String extensionPointId = "com.yantra.pca.scv.rcp.Test1";
 
                // The root element name of the extension pont.
                String rootElementName = "AlertConfigPanel";
 
                // Create a map, which contains the filter criteria you are looking for.
                HashMap filterMap = new HashMap();
                // Add the filters to the map.
                filterMap.put("AlertType", "PO Delayed");
                filterMap.put("EnterpriseCode", "DEFAULT");
 
                // The following method retrieves data from the extension point, by matching the filter criteria.
                // This method returns the content of the <i>value</i> attribute from the matching <i>ExtensionValue</i> element.
                // So based on the example above the following method should return a value <i>Val1</i>
                String extensionValue = YRCPlatformUI.getExtensionPointString(extensionPointId, , "Arg1", filterMap);
                
                // The following method creates a new instance of the implementation class as specified in the 
                // <i>className</i> attribute int the extension point, by matching the filter criteria.
                Object obj = YRCPlatformUI.getExtensionPointClass("com.yantra.pca.scv.rcp.Test1", "AlertConfigPanel", filterMap);
        Parameters:
        extensionPointId - The id of the extension point.
        extensionRootElementName - The root element name of the extension point. Can be null.
        extensionFilterMap - The map of filter values based on which the extension is identified.
        Returns:
        An object of the class which is specified in the className attribute associated with the extension point.

      • getExtensionPointPanel

        public static java.lang.Object getExtensionPointPanel(java.lang.String extensionPointId,
                                                      java.lang.String extensionRootElementName,
                                                      java.util.HashMap extensionFilterMap,
                                                      org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent,
                                                      int style)
        Utility method to return an object of the class which is specified in the className attribute associated with the extension point.
        This method is used when the class being created is a gui screen.
        For the usage and other information regarding this method see getExtensionPointClass(String, String, HashMap)
        IMPORTANT: Only one difference exists between getExtensionPointPanel and getExtensionPointClass methods, which is:
        • className attribute should point to a java class as documented by the rcp application providing the extension point and should have a constructor with arguments (Composite parent, int style).
        Parameters:
        extensionPointId - The id of the extension point.
        extensionRootElementName - The root element name of the extension point. Can be null.
        extensionFilterMap - The map of filter values based on which the extension is identified.
        parent - The parent composite using which the extension screen panel will be created.
        style - The style constant of the panel.
        Returns:
        An object of the class which is specified in the className attribute associated with the extension point.

        Utility method to check if the workbench is being forced closed. In returns true, dirty check will be disabled

      • registerJob

        public static void registerJob(YRCJob job)
        Every plugin must register its job with the Platform using this method. Once registerd, these jobs will be scheduled after the workbench window is opened. Alert specific job should not be registered using this method. Instead it should be registered using registerAlertJob(IYRCAlertPopupHandler, YRCJobData)
        Parameters:
        job - the job which needs to be executed.
        See Also:
        registerAlertJob(IYRCAlertPopupHandler, YRCJobData)

      • registerAlertJob

        public static void registerAlertJob(IYRCAlertPopupHandler alertPopupHandler,
                                    YRCJobData jobData)
        Alert related Job should be resigtered with Platform using this method at the time the plugin invokes. The job which need to show some alert specific details should provide an alertPopupHandler which will be invoked when user clicks on the view details of the alert message.
        Parameters:
        alertPopupHandler - The handler for the pop up, which will be invoked when the alert is clicked.
        jobData - this contains the job specific information. Like time interval after which job needs to be rescheduled etc.
        See Also:
        registerJob(YRCJob)

      • isDisplayResolutionLow

        public static boolean isDisplayResolutionLow()
        Returns:
        true if the resolution of the desktop is "low". If the desktop's resolution has a width less than or equal to 850 pixels, it is considered to be a low resolution display.

      • isPosMode

        public static boolean isPosMode()
        Returns:
        true if the current application is opened in POS mode.

      • getShell

        public static org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell getShell()
        Returns:
        Returns a shell with current shell style being used across the application. The need arises because of the extensibility purposes. Some of the shells may be extensible.
        Note: The same shell is reused across the application. In case, the shell is disposed, or new styled shell needs to be used, a new shell is created and returned.

      • startTimer

        public static void startTimer(java.lang.String formid,
                              java.lang.String identifier)
        Utility method to start the timer.All timer related statements are written to a separate file {debugfile}_timer.log. It is highly suggested that the utility method isTimerTraceEnabled() be used ,to avoid any overhead .
        Parameters:
        formid - is the formid of a screen which requires any timing information to be captured
        identifier - is a unique identifier like api name , model namespace name , page id ,rule id etc

      • endTimer

        public static void endTimer(java.lang.String formid,
                            java.lang.String identifier,
                            java.lang.String operation,
                            java.lang.String message)
        Utility method to end the timer .All timer related statements are written to a separate file {debugfile}_timer.log. It is highly suggested that the utility method isTimerTraceEnabled() be used ,to avoid any overhead .
        Parameters:
        formid - - It is the formid of the screen which requires timing information to be captured. In case of wizards it is the wizard id.
        identifier- - the same identifier used to start the timer
        operation - - It is some general information ,only to improve the readability of the log entries. Ex:"Api Complete", "Set model", "Get Target Model".
        message - - Any message the user requires. "message" can even be additional variables the user wants to capture at the end of the timer .

      • addTraceMessageFilter

        public static void addTraceMessageFilter(IYRCTraceMessageFilter messageFilter)
        Utility method to add a new trace message filter.
        NOTE: The filter will be called prior to tracing the log statement. There is no guaranteed sequence in which filters will be called.
        These filters can be used to hide/filter sensitive information like credit card/passwords/CVV numbers from the logs.
        Parameters:
        messageFilter - A concrete implementation of the message filter.
        See Also:
        IYRCTraceMessageFilter

        Parameters:
        isActivityTrackingEnabled - True to enable analytic event collection, False to disable event collection.

        NOTE: The event object cannot be null.
        Parameters:
        event - The event to be raised

      • getPluginPropertiesMap

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,YRCPluginProperty> getPluginPropertiesMap()
        Utility method to get the details about plugin such as build, version etc . This information will be needed to make a custom About Dialog. The details have to be registered with platform using method YRCPlatformUI.registerAboutPluginProperties(String propertiesFileName,String pluginID ) for it to be available in the map.
        Returns:
        map of plugin details.

      • getPluginAddinPropertiesMap

        public static java.util.Map getPluginAddinPropertiesMap()
        Utility method to get details about registered addin properties of a plugin such as build and versoin.This information will be needed to make a custom About Dialog. The details have to be registered with platform using method YRCPlatformUI.registerAddinProperties(String propertiesFileName,String pluginID ) for it to be available in the map.
        Returns:
        map of addin properties of a plugin.

      • getPluginLoadOrderList

        plugin load order list.
